abstract: Update | 8:45 a.m.  Dow Chemical said early Tuesday that it lost $1.55 billion for the fourth quarter, or $1.68 a share, compared to a profit of 49 cents a share at the same time in 2007. Sales fell 23 percent to $10.9 billion. Read the press release here. Dow has also filed its response; read it here.
lead_paragraph: Update | 8:45 a.m.  Dow Chemical said early Tuesday that it lost $1.55 billion for the fourth quarter, or $1.68 a share, compared to a profit of 49 cents a share at the same time in 2007. Sales fell 23 percent to $10.9 billion. Read the press release here. Dow has also filed its response; read it here.

abstract: Dow Chemical argued Tuesday that it had no legal obligation to carry out its deal to buy Rohm & Haas because current economic conditions had made it impossible to close “without jeopardizing the very existence of both companies.”
lead_paragraph: Dow Chemical argued Tuesday that it had no legal obligation to carry out its deal to buy Rohm & Haas because current economic conditions had made it impossible to close “without jeopardizing the very existence of both companies.”

headline.main: Dow Argues Rohm Deal Is Not Binding

abstract: As I postulated, Dow Chemical’s answer on Tuesday to Rohm & Haas‘s lawsuit was not filled with many surprises. Its response can be characterized as a “global force majeure,” “woe is me” or “mercy please” argument.
lead_paragraph: As I postulated, Dow Chemical’s answer on Tuesday to Rohm & Haas‘s lawsuit was not filled with many surprises. Its response can be characterized as a “global force majeure,” “woe is me” or “mercy please” argument.

headline.main: A Hard Look at Dow’s Answer to Rohm
